sn6.11:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the bank of the Sappinī river.
sn6.11:1.3: Then, late at night, the beautiful Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra, lighting up the entire Sappinī riverbank, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side,
sn6.11:1.4: and recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn6.11:2.1: “The aristocrat is best of those people
sn6.11:2.2: who take clan as the standard.
sn6.11:2.3: But one accomplished in knowledge and conduct
sn6.11:2.4: is best of gods and humans.”
sn6.11:3.3: Then Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
